alert.note: Alert for Western Prince William Sound (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 08 at 5:50AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...ACCUMULATING SNOW LIKELY THROUGH THE WEEKEND... A complex area of low pressure moving toward the region from the Gulf of Alaska will bring accumulating snow to the eastern Kenai Peninsula, mainly from Portage Valley to Moose Pass, for the weekend. Light snow will persist through the day Saturday before heavier snow develops Saturday night into Sunday morning. Snow should taper off again on Sunday afternoon. Although there is still uncertainty in the exact track and timing of this system, 4 to 8 inches of snow is likely along the Seward Highway from Girdwood to Moose Pass. The Moose Pass to Seward stretch of the Seward highway should see about 3 to 6 inches. Highest amounts should be from from Portage Valley to Whittier with around 12 inches of accumulation. Blowing snow may reduce visibility under a mile at times in Portage Valley and Whittier on Sunday. Visibility may also be reduced at times Sunday across the rest of the area due to the snowfall and increasing northwesterly winds. For the latest forecast, visit www.weather.gov/afc
